00032 // Implementation for the InternalErr class.

00040 static char rcsid[] not_used = {"$Id$"};

00047 #include "InternalErr.h"
00048 #include "util.h"
00049 
00050 using std::endl;
00051 using std::ostringstream;
00052 
00053 InternalErr::InternalErr() : Error()
00054 {
00055     _error_code=internal_error;
00056 }
00057 
00058 InternalErr::InternalErr(const string &msg) : Error()
00059 {
00060     _error_code=internal_error;
00061     _error_message="";
00062     _error_message+="An internal error was encountered:\n";
00063     _error_message+=msg+"\n";
00064     _error_message+="Please report this to support@unidata.ucar.edu\n";
00065 }
00066 
00067 
00068 //InternalErr::InternalErr(string msg, string file, int line)
00069 //    : Error(unknown_error, msg)
00070 InternalErr::InternalErr(const string &file, const int &line, const string &msg) : Error()
00071 {
00072     _error_code=internal_error;
00073     _error_message="";
00074     _error_message+="An internal error was encountered in "+file+" at line ";
00075     // Jose Garcia. Next we append line to the string _error_code.
00076     // This function is defined in util.h
00077     append_long_to_string(line,10,_error_message);
00078     _error_message+=":\n";
00079     _error_message+=msg+"\n";
00080     _error_message+="Please report this to support@unidata.ucar.edu\n";
00081 }
00082 
00083 InternalErr::InternalErr(string msg, ProgramType pt, char *pgm)
00084     : Error(unknown_error, msg, pt, pgm) 
00085 {
00086     ostringstream oss;
00087     oss << "An internal error was encountered:" << endl
00088     << msg << endl
00089     << "Please report this to support@unidata.ucar.edu";
00090     _error_message  = oss.str();
00091 }
00092 
00093 InternalErr::InternalErr(const InternalErr &copy_from)
00094     : Error(copy_from)
00095 {
00096 }    
00097 
00098 InternalErr::~InternalErr()
00099 {
00100 }
00101 
00105 bool
00106 InternalErr::OK()
00107 {
00108     return Error::OK();
00109 }

00151 // Revision 1.5  2000/09/21 16:22:08  jimg
00152 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00153 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exceptions. There are
00154 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00155 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00156 // the library. Error is used to report all other errors. Since InternalErr
00157 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
